abstract: Margaret Palmer, a waterway-restoration expert, was one of three scientists who recently traveled from the United States to North Korea to attend an environmental conference. Deforestation during a horrifying famine in the 1990s - when people were reduced to eating grass and bark - continues to cripple North Korean agriculture.

headline.main: U.S. Scientists See a Denuded Landscape in North Korea
